Cryptocurrency stocks fall in pre-market trading; MicroStrategy (MSTR.O) down 2%
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News Cryptocurrency stocks fell in pre-market trading as Bitcoin fell more than 3%. Coinbase (COIN.O) fell 1%, MicroStrategy (MSTR.O) fell 2%. Riot Platforms (RIOT.O) fell 1.4%, Hut 8 Mining fell 2.8%, and Mara Holdings fell 1.5%.

data.title: US moving toward a national sovereign fund: Bitcoin among the investments?
data.description:
Trump’s executive order revives hopes for a Bitcoin investment by the U.S., but its connection to the asset is not guaranteed.

data.title: Binance Market Update (2025-02-04)
data.description:
The global cryptocurrency market cap now stands at $3.12T, down by -7.54% over the last day, according to CoinMarketCap data.

Bitcoin (BTC) has been trading between $94,131 and $102,500 over the past 24 hours. As of 09:30 AM (UTC) today, BTC is trading at $98,600, up by 2.87%.

Most major cryptocurrencies by market cap are trading mixed. Market outperformers include UTK, QTUM, and VTHO, up by 37%, 26%, and 18%, respectively.

Top stories of the day:

Real-World Asset Tokenization Markets Reach New Heights

Ethereum Validators Support Gas Limit Increase

China Imposes Tariffs on U.S. Imports, Targets Energy and Machinery

Eric Trump Advocates for Adding ETH, Calls Market Timing Ideal

Ethereum Co-Founder Vitalik Buterin Praises L1 Expansion Efforts

Bitcoin's Potential For Record High By March 2025: Prediction Market

U.S. Congress Prepares For Busy Day Of Cryptocurrency Policy Making

Trump Signs Executive Order For Sovereign Wealth Fund

U.S. Government to Outline Digital Asset Leadership Plans

Digital Asset Funds Register $527M in Inflows Despite Market Turbulence

Yi He Promises Enhanced Transparency in Binance's Coin Listing Process
